modules.description: This module defines infix operators for composing and redirecting shell commands. It provides redirection of standard output and error to files, input redirection from files, and logical command sequencing. These operations are used to build complex shell pipelines directly in OCaml code.

This module provides a domain-specific language for composing and executing shell-like commands, centered around the `cmd` type representing processes. It supports operations like piping, sequencing, and background execution, with combinators for transforming output line-by-line, manipulating files, and processing text in a Unix-like style. The child module adds infix operators for command composition, input/output redirection, and logical sequencing, enabling the construction of complex shell pipelines directly in OCaml. Examples include chaining `cmd` values with `|>` to process output, redirecting streams to files using `>` and `2>`, and running commands in parallel using background operators.
